title: How to Make an Easy Mango Popsicle

steps.headline: Take a plastic cup or glass.
steps.description: Or, use a popsicle maker container.

steps.headline: Pour half the plastic container with milk.
Add the mango pulp in the remaining part of the container.
Add three teaspoons of sugar.
steps.description: If you need more or less, then add as much as you want.

steps.headline: Stir it well or beat it well.
Add an ice cream stick to the container, keeping it in the center.
Freeze it for sometime in the freezer.
Take it out of the cup or container when it is frozen.
You can lick the mango ice candy and taste it out using the stick!
Chill the mango lemonade juice or regular mango juice.
steps.description: It must be cold or it won't turn out correctly.

steps.headline: Pour the juice into a plastic cup or popsicle container.
steps.description: It can be short or long, up to you.

steps.headline: Put the juice and container in the freezer overnight.
Remove the next day.
steps.description: To remove from the cup or container, pour a little warm water over the outside of the container to unstick it or let it thaw for a little while.

steps.headline: Chill a mango until it is nice and cold.
steps.description: Cut into slices or cubes. It needs to be cold so that the popsicle will come out with a good texture.

steps.headline: Place the slices or cubes it in the blender.
steps.description: Add a little warm water to assist the blending.

steps.headline: Transfer the blended mixture to the popsicle container(s).
Place it in the freezer overnight to set.

tyn: Ice cream stick (or one that comes with the popsicle container)
text: Mango Milk Popsicle Take a plastic cup or glass. Or, use a popsicle maker container. Pour half the plastic container with milk.  Add the mango pulp in the remaining part of the container.  Add three teaspoons of sugar. If you need more or less, then add as much as you want. Stir it well or beat it well.  Add an ice cream stick to the container, keeping it in the center.  Freeze it for sometime in the freezer.  Take it out of the cup or container when it is frozen.  You can lick the mango ice candy and taste it out using the stick!  Finished.  Mango Juice Popsicle Chill the mango lemonade juice or regular mango juice. It must be cold or it won't turn out correctly. Pour the juice into a plastic cup or popsicle container. It can be short or long, up to you. Put the juice and container in the freezer overnight.  Remove the next day. To remove from the cup or container, pour a little warm water over the outside of the container to unstick it or let it thaw for a little while. Mango Fruit Popsicle Chill a mango until it is nice and cold. Cut into slices or cubes. It needs to be cold so that the popsicle will come out with a good texture. Place the slices or cubes it in the blender. Add a little warm water to assist the blending. Transfer the blended mixture to the popsicle container(s).  Place it in the freezer overnight to set.  Remove the next day. Serve frozen.
sentences: Mango Milk Popsicle Take a plastic cup or glass.
Or, use a popsicle maker container.
Pour half the plastic container with milk.
Add the mango pulp in the remaining part of the container.
Add three teaspoons of sugar.
If you need more or less, then add as much as you want.
Stir it well or beat it well.
Add an ice cream stick to the container, keeping it in the center.
Freeze it for sometime in the freezer.
Take it out of the cup or container when it is frozen.
You can lick the mango ice candy and taste it out using the stick!
Finished.
Mango Juice Popsicle Chill the mango lemonade juice or regular mango juice.
It must be cold or it won't turn out correctly.
Pour the juice into a plastic cup or popsicle container.
It can be short or long, up to you.
Put the juice and container in the freezer overnight.
Remove the next day.
To remove from the cup or container, pour a little warm water over the outside of the container to unstick it or let it thaw for a little while.
Mango Fruit Popsicle Chill a mango until it is nice and cold.
Cut into slices or cubes.
It needs to be cold so that the popsicle will come out with a good texture.
Place the slices or cubes it in the blender.
Add a little warm water to assist the blending.
Transfer the blended mixture to the popsicle container(s).
Place it in the freezer overnight to set.
Remove the next day.
Serve frozen.
